meanings.definition: A substance found in dormant seeds that inhibits germination.
meanings.sent1: The dormin in the seed prevents it from sprouting too early.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study dormin to understand how seeds stay asleep until the right time.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel sprinkled extra dormin on the garden to keep the plants napping.
meanings.sent4: The dormin in the seed acts like a guardian, ensuring it wakes up only when ready.
meanings.sent5: Imagine dormin as a tiny alarm clock inside the seed, controlling when it wakes up.

meanings.definition: A medication used to induce sleep.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed dormin to help the patient fall asleep faster.
meanings.sent2: Taking dormin before bed can make you feel drowsy and ready for rest.
meanings.sent3: After taking dormin, the character in the story slept so deeply, they dreamt of flying.
meanings.sent4: The dormin worked like a magical potion, lulling the person into a peaceful slumber.
meanings.sent5: With dormin, falling asleep becomes as easy as counting sheep under a starry sky.
